page.title: 18Schoolday in Watford. (2)
page.content: For breakfast I have 'Start', a cereal with honey. I leave home at 8.45am as the school whistle goes at 9.00am. If I have time before school I watch Breakfast TV. A few years ago there was no such programme. Now 2 channels show it. Altogether we have 4 channels. Our class has 25 children and nearly half have video recorders. We have register first then up to Assembly where we all gather together to sing and hear stories. We usually have maths until playtime. Playtime lasts for 15 mins. We are allowed to bring crisps or biscuits to eat. In the playground many games are played-football, hopscotch, leapfrog, hom-pom or red rover. In the latter there are 2 teams, one making a wall by holding hands. A membere of the other team has to break through. After play we do written work. Our lunchbreak is from 12.00 to 1.30pm.
